availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel Wolsey Voorhees (Vigo County, Indiana, U.S. representative and attorney, D.A.)

body.p: Vigo County, Indiana, attorney and politician. Liberty Township, Ohio, native. Married to Anna Hardesty Voorhees. Father of Harriet Cecelia Voorhees, Charles S. Voorhees, James P Voorhees, and Reese H Voorhees. Graduated from Indiana Asbury University in Greencastle, Indiana, in 1849. Attorney in Covington, Indiana, in 1850. United States district attorney for Indiana from 1858 to 1861. Attorney in Vigo County in 1860. Employed Mary Walsh and Hannah Manegan as domestic servants in Vigo County in 1860. Member of the Democratic Party. Member of the United States House of Representatives from 1861 to 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Fountain County, Covington, p. 60A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vigo County, Terre Haute, Ward 2, p. 675.
John Fiske and James Grant Wilson, ed., Appleton's Cyclopædia of American Biography, vol. 6, (New York: Appleton, 1889), 307.
“ Voorhees, Daniel Wolsey(1827-1897),” Biographical Directory of the United States Congress, accessed April 29, 2021, https://bioguide.congress.gov/search/bio/V000116.
Find A Grave, “Daniel Wolsey Voorhees (1827-1897)," Memorial # 1716, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/1716/daniel-wolsey-voorhees (accessed April 29, 2021).
